Articles.Content:
Thanks, I was just thinking about terrain below you being at a different level of detail than the stuff far off to the sides - if the explosions only happened when you came in low and fast it could have been the ships coming off rails, adjusting to the terrain, and then the terrain under them changing as the focused ship got closer - I guess that\'s not the case. Oh well!

Put my name down for a turn at placing a lander. I will limit myself to whatever mod parts have already been used by others before me!

Who\'s up for a bombing run on the mun?! that should clear it up!

...

well, its an idea. with explosions.

All I can think of is a craft that has landing legs as a claw and can hover over the debris and scoop them up one at a time.

But I\'d either need upside down legs or an upside down engine.
Hmm. Sounds like we need a mod to make it easier
We need a bulldozer on the Mun
There must be half a dozen kerbals stranded on the Mun. Some one ship in some oxy-torches and get them to break it all down.

Just as when several ships get beached in one place and people end up making a town out of the hulls, here we have a village made of the wrecked hulls of unfortunate spaceships, their inhabitants trapped and having to make the best of things.
Does anyone know when 14.1 comes out? I\'d like to get my ship somewhere close to the others and intact >.<
From what he has said they will be taking this week to fix the bugs, so hopefully at the end of this one/early next week.

Also, we should look into this mod. Yay moon rovers!

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=8431.0;topicseen

Also, we should look into this mod. Yay moon rovers!

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=8431.0;topicseen

Ok, this is a mod I approve of.
Maybe we can fit something wide on the front?

Maybe we can fit something wide on the front?

A kerbal that has eaten too many donuts?
Everyone knows Kerbals eat grass thats all there is in Kerbin.
Not true. My kerbals eat rockets for breakfast and suck vacuum for lunch.
Actually mine seem to live on their nerves, they are always screaming
I was planning on trying to make a skyscraper to send to the moon. It ended up like this: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=8420.0
After seeing the rover I can\'t let the mun base go without mods, so mods are now allowed! We need a bulldozer!
Agreed, but lets not let the mods get out of control.

Agreed, but lets not let the mods get out of control.

I agree, but the rover mod is a must. It\'s only one part, and it is very useful.

I suggest the BACE moonbase modules (or alternative) + the rover + stock (of course).

This will allow some very interesting moonbase configurations without forcing us all to d/l a gazillion mods.

It should also be noted that those that don\'t want to \'ruin\' their stock game with modes can copy/paste their game into a new folder and use that second copy of the game (with mods) for the community moonbase. That way they can have two copies installed and people can use which ever version they wish - there normal stock game or the modded version for the moonbase.
I agree with Togfox. Mods, but with moderation would be best for me.
14.1 is out! Let\'s rev up them engines!
Alright, Samonite will go next, if the bug still exists we may have to restart.

In several test landings (with a clean stock install of 0.14.1) I\'ve seen hard bounces or worse on resuming control of a landed craft. The most impressively bad was the one that resumed about 20m underground - far enough that it just froze up there and I couldn\'t do anything but close the game if I switched to that craft. I\'ll be doing further testing tonight, but I think there\'s definitely something wrong still.
